reporter_caption.center: ALIHASSAN v. BD. OF ZONING APPEALS, 94 Ohio St.3d 1249 (2002)

caption.center: Alihassan v. Alliance Board of Zoning Appeals et al., Appellees.

opinion.posture: Appeal from the Court of Appeals for Stark County, No. 1999CA00402.Page 1250
opinion.opinion_text:
The cause is dismissed, sua sponte, as having been improvidently allowed.
MOYER, C.J., DOUGLAS, RESNICK, F.E. SWEENEY, PFEIFER and LUNDBERG STRATTON, JJ., concur.
COOK, J., dissents.
opinion.dissent_text: Because I would reverse the judgment of the court of appeals and remand the cause for dismissal, I respectfully dissent.
opinion.attorneys:
Kahn, Kleinman, Yanowitz Arnson Co., L.P.A., Sheldon Berns and Benjamin J. Ockner, for appellant.
Andrew L. Zumbar, Alliance Law Director, for appellees Alliance Board of Zoning Appeals, Warren Price, Alliance City Planning Commission, Bob Sanderson, and Ronald L. Russell.
Dennis R. Clunk, for appellee Mount Union College.Page 1251
